The correct sequence is A: 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5.
He greets the audience first, followed by his disappointment about the end of his sluicing season. Then, he mentions going back to a stream where he previously dug and sluiced. After that, there's a mention of setting up and counting buckets, which implies that the digging and sluicing activity has already taken place. Finally, he comments on the results of panning, indicating that the activity has concluded.

The correct sequence is A: 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5. 

Firstly, he starts by saying he will go further downstream to explore 'hotspots' which implies that he has already reached the stream mentioned later in the sequence. Then, he jokes about making an omelette with a prawn, indicating that he has already collected something from the water. After that, he makes a comment about the quality of the ground being better than the previous week, suggesting that he has been digging. This leads us to the next event where he mentions twelve buckets and his intention to vacuum or clean a carpet, implying that he has finished digging for the day. Finally, he wraps up the video by showing the last 12 buckets of the season filled with mushrooms, indicating that this was the end of his season of digging.

Therefore, the sequence of events is: He goes to the stream, collects something, digs, finishes digging, and shows the results of his work.
